validation.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 6 characters

welcome.title: Welcome to personnel management!
welcome.description: Here you can manage all the technicians in your company. We'll show you the main features.

addTechnician.title: Add technician
addTechnician.description: Click here to register a new technician in the system. You can assign specific roles and permissions.

searchTechnicians.title: Search technicians
searchTechnicians.description: Use this search bar to find specific technicians by their username.

technicianActions.title: Technician actions
technicianActions.description: In the table you can view each technician's profile, edit their information or delete users when necessary.

home.title: Dashboard
home.subtitle: General operations summary
home.ordersWillAppear: Orders will appear here when created

installations.title: Installations
installations.typeNameMin: Name must be at least 2 characters
installations.typeNameMax: Name cannot be more than 100 characters
installations.typeDescriptionMax: Description cannot be more than 500 characters
installations.noTypesSubtext: Installation types will appear here once created
installations.noCategoriesSubtext: Categories will appear here once created
installations.confirmDeleteCategory: Are you sure you want to delete this category?
installations.confirmDeleteInstallationType: Are you sure you want to delete this installation type?

installations.createAssetsFirst: First create assets in the corresponding section

installations.installationTypesWillAppearHere: Installation types will appear here once you create them

validation.categoryNameMin: Name must be at least 2 characters
validation.typeNameMin: Name must be at least 2 characters

installations.confirmDeleteDescription: This action cannot be undone. The installation will be permanently deleted.

welcome.title: Welcome to Installations!
welcome.description: We'll guide you step by step to learn how to manage your installations. First you need to create an installation type, then you can create installations.

createInstallationType.title: Step 1: Create Installation Type
createInstallationType.description: Before creating an installation, you need to define an installation type (e.g., Office, Factory, Warehouse, etc.). Click here to create your first type.

viewInstallationTypes.title: View Installation Types
viewInstallationTypes.description: Here you can view and manage all the installation types you've created.

createInstallation.title: Step 2: Create Installation
createInstallation.description: Once you've created at least one installation type, use this button to create your first installation. Enter company data, address, and select the installation type.

searchFilter.title: Search and Filter
searchFilter.description: Use this bar to search installations by name, address, or city, and filter by installation type.

assets.title: Assets

welcome.title: Welcome to Assets!
welcome.description: We'll guide you step by step to learn how to manage your assets. First you need to create a form template, then you can create assets.

goToForms.title: Step 1: Go to Forms
goToForms.description: To create an asset, you first need a form template. Click on 'Forms' in the side menu to create your first template.

createFormTemplate.title: Step 2: Create Form Template
createFormTemplate.description: Here you can create a form template that will serve as a structure for your assets. Define the fields you need (text, number, date, etc.).

viewFormCategories.title: View Form Categories
viewFormCategories.description: You can organize your templates into categories. Click here to view and manage existing categories.

createAsset.title: Step 3: Create Asset
createAsset.description: Once you have at least one form template, use this button to create your first asset. Select the template and fill in the fields.

searchFilter.title: Search and Filter
searchFilter.description: Use this bar to search for assets by name or template, and filter by template category.

assets.name: Name
assets.searchPlaceholder: Search by name, brand, model, serial number or template
assets.confirmDeleteAssetDescription: Are you sure you want to delete this asset? This action cannot be undone.

forms.title: Form Templates

welcome.title: Welcome to Form Templates!
welcome.description: We'll guide you step by step to learn how to create and manage form templates for your assets.

createCategory.title: Step 1: Create Category
createCategory.description: First create a category to organize your templates. Categories help you classify your forms (e.g., Equipment, Vehicles, Machinery).

viewCategories.title: View Created Categories
viewCategories.description: Here you can view and manage all the categories you've created. You can edit or delete existing categories.

createTemplate.title: Step 2: Create Form Template
createTemplate.description: Once you have categories, use this button to create your first template. Define the fields you need for your assets (name, serial number, purchase date, etc.).

searchFilter.title: Search and Filter
searchFilter.description: Use this bar to search templates by name or description, and filter by category.

forms.confirmDeleteTemplate: Are you sure you want to delete this template?
forms.name: Name
forms.confirmDeleteCategory: Are you sure you want to delete the category "{{name}}"?
forms.deleteCategoryWarning: This action cannot be undone. The category will be permanently deleted.
forms.addAtLeastOneField: You must add at least one field
forms.fieldNameInvalid: Field name can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores

validation.templateDescriptionMax: Description cannot be more than 500 characters
validation.categoryMax: Category cannot be more than 50 characters
validation.fieldsMin: You must provide at least one field
validation.fieldOptionsMin: You must provide at least one option
validation.fieldOptionsRequired: Options are required for select or radio fields

manuals.searchPlaceholder: Search by name, description, author, version or tags
manuals.author: Author
manuals.confirmDeleteManualDescription: This action will delete the manual and its associated file. This cannot be undone.
manuals.selectPdfFile: Select a PDF file for the manual
manuals.name: Name
manuals.requiredPdfFile: A PDF file is required to create the manual
manuals.tagPlaceholder: Type a tag and press Enter
manuals.dragDrop: Drag and drop or click to select
manuals.fileHint: * A PDF file is required to create the manual
manuals.confirmDeleteDescription: This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

validation.nameMin: Manual name must be at least 3 characters
validation.tagsMax: You cannot add more than 10 tags

welcome.title: Welcome to Manuals!
welcome.description: Here you can manage the manuals for your assets. We'll show you how this section works.

goToAssets.title: Go to Assets
goToAssets.description: To create a manual, you first need to have at least one asset created. Click here to go to the Assets section and create your first asset.

createManual.title: Create Manual
createManual.description: Once you have assets created, use this button to create a manual. You can associate it with an asset, upload PDF files, and add information such as version, author, and language.

searchFilter.title: Search and Filter
searchFilter.description: Use this bar to search manuals by name, description, author, or tags, and filter by category.

subscriptions.title: Active Subscriptions
subscriptions.subtitle: Subscription and active billing management

errors.endDateAfterStart: End date must be after the start date
errors.frequencyRequired: Frequency is required to activate the subscription

subscriptions.selectTwoMonthsSemestral: Select 2 months spaced every 6 months (e.g., January and July)
subscriptions.selectFourMonthsTrimestral: Select 4 months spaced every 3 months (e.g., January, April, July, October)
subscriptions.selectDatesFirst: Please select start and end dates first

welcome.title: Welcome to Active Subscriptions!
welcome.description: Here you can manage maintenance subscriptions for your installations. We'll show you how this section works.

goToInstallations.title: Go to Installations
goToInstallations.description: Before creating a subscription, make sure you have at least one installation created. Click here to go to the Installations section and create it.

searchFilter.title: Search and Filter
searchFilter.description: Use the search bar to find subscriptions by installation, address, or type. You can also filter by month to see which subscriptions are active in a specific month.

editFrequency.title: Edit Frequency
editFrequency.description: Click this button to change the subscription frequency (monthly, quarterly, semiannual, or annual) and adjust the months when maintenance will be performed.

months.title: Selected Months
months.description: Here are shown the months when maintenance will be performed according to the configured frequency. Months are automatically adjusted according to the chosen frequency.

calendar.title: Work Order Calendar
calendar.searchPlaceholder: Search by title, description, installation or technician

workOrders.title: Work orders
workOrders.searchPlaceholder: Search by title, description, installation or technician
workOrders.descriptionPlaceholder: Description of the work to be performed

modals.confirmDeleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this work order?
modals.confirmDeleteDescription: This action cannot be undone. All related data will be lost.
modals.assignTechnicianMessage: Select a technician to assign to this work order
modals.completeOrderMessage: Are you sure you want to mark this order as completed?
modals.startOrderMessage: Are you sure you want to start this work order?

validation.titleMin: Title must be at least 3 characters
validation.titleMax: Title cannot be more than 200 characters
validation.descriptionMin: Description must be at least 10 characters
validation.descriptionMax: Description cannot be more than 1000 characters
validation.scheduledDateMin: Scheduled date cannot be in the past
validation.scheduledTimeFormat: Time must be in HH:MM format
validation.observationsMax: Notes cannot be more than 500 characters

completion.workDoneMin: Work done must be at least 10 characters
completion.observationsMin: Notes must be at least 10 characters

welcome.title: Welcome to Work Orders!
welcome.description: Work orders allow you to manage maintenance tasks, repairs, and inspections. First, you need to create technicians and installations to be able to assign and locate the orders.

createTechnician.title: Step 1: Create Technicians
createTechnician.description: Click here to go to the Personnel section. You need to register technicians who can be assigned to work orders.

createInstallation.title: Step 2: Create Installations
createInstallation.description: Click here to go to Installations. You need to have installations registered where work orders will be performed.

createWorkOrder.title: Step 3: Create Work Order
createWorkOrder.description: Once you have technicians and installations, use this button to create your first work order. Define the title, description, work type, priority, scheduled date and time.

searchFilter.title: Search and Filter
searchFilter.description: Use this bar to search for orders by title, description, installation or technician, and filter by status (Pending, Assigned, In progress, Completed).

workOrderActions.title: Work Order Actions
workOrderActions.description:
Each order shows different actions depending on its status:

• Pending: Assign technician, Edit, Delete
• Assigned: Start order, Edit, Delete
• In progress: Complete order
• Completed: View only

Technicians can start and complete their assigned orders.

installationDetails.scanQRDescription: Scan this code to access the maintenance form
installationDetails.searchDevicesPlaceholder: Search by device, location or category...
installationDetails.noDevicesFound: No devices found with that search term

welcome.title: Welcome to Installation Details!
welcome.description: Here you can manage all devices for this installation. We'll show you how this section works.

goToInstallations.title: Go to Installations
goToInstallations.description: Before adding devices, make sure to create device categories from the Installations section. Click here to go to that section.

createAssetFirst.title: Important: Create Assets First
createAssetFirst.description: Before adding a device to this installation, you must first create an asset in the Assets section. Assets serve as the base/template for devices in installations.

addDevice.title: Add Device
addDevice.description: Use this button to add a new device to the installation. You'll need to select the category, location, status, and other device details.

searchFilter.title: Search and Filter
searchFilter.description: Use this bar to search for devices by name, location, or category. You can also filter by device status.

deviceActions.title: Device Actions
deviceActions.description: Each device card has buttons to: view QR code, download last maintenance (PDF), edit the device, and delete it.

login.title: Login
login.subtitle: Please enter your credentials to continue
login.minPassword: Password must be at least 6 characters

deviceForm.offline: Offline – data will be saved locally
deviceForm.localSaveNote: Data will be saved locally and submitted when online

validations.locationMin: Location must be at least 1 character
validations.deviceNameMin: Name must be at least 1 character

notFound.title: Page not found
notFound.description: Sorry, the page you're looking for doesn't exist or has been moved. Check the URL and try again.
notFound.suggestion1: Check that the URL is written correctly
notFound.suggestion2: Use the navigation menu to access available sections
notFound.suggestion3: Contact the administrator if you think this is an error
